title: Logo book - body font ID
content:
Hi

Does anyone know the ID of the body font used in the new book ’Logo’? The book design is by Spin, I can’t put my finger on the typeface name. it looks very much like Din17 but a bit rounder - any ideas? I don’t have an image as no camera with me now, but if you have the book?!

Thanks

 [‹ Digital Version of old film type Wexford?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220142620/http:/typophile.com/node/42139 "Go to previous forum topic") [A Number of Fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220142620/http:/typophile.com/node/42162 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Parent

comments.content:
Lineto’s Typ1451 or Optimo’s Gravostyle, perhaps?

[http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Typ1451/Medium/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220142620/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Typ1451/Medium/ "http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Typ1451/Medium/")

[http://optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id\_categorie=1&id\_font=17](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220142620/http:/optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id_categorie=1&id_font=17 "http://optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id\_categorie=1&id\_font=17")
Thanks for posting the pic... Typ1451 confirmed?
Nice one! thanks for the ID and the pic post.
